voca.means_en:
When people or things are apart, they are some distance from each other.
If two people or things move apart or are pulled apart, they move away from each other.
If two people are apart, they are no longer living together or spending time together, either permanently or just for a short time.
You use apart from when you are making an exception to a general statement.
New Zealand's 7.8 magnitude quake ripped this mountain apart by 10 metres.
always\nOverall, I’m not a fashionable person. However, I do like to look presentable at all times.\n
I am interested in fashion trends, but I don’t always follow them.\n
The belly of a person or animal is their stomach or abdomen. In British English, this is an informal or literary use.\nIf a company goes belly up, it does not have enough money to pay its debts.\n

A bombardment is a strong and continuous attack of gunfire or bombing.
A bombardment of ideas, demands, questions, or criticisms is an aggressive and exhausting stream of them.
Volunteers pull a girl through a tiny gap, high up in the wreckage of a partially-destroyed building as Aleppo bombardment continues.

Breakfast is the first meal of the day. It is usually eaten in the early part of the morning.
When you breakfast, you have breakfast.
A : Have you had breakfast?

A car pool is an arrangement where a group of people take turns driving each other to work, or driving each other's children to school. In American English, car pool is sometimes used to refer simply to people travelling together in a car.\n

If you are casual, you are, or you pretend to be, relaxed and not very concerned about what is happening or what you are doing.
A casual event or situation happens by chance or without planning.
Casual clothes are ones that you normally wear at home or on holiday, and not on formal occasions.
Casual work is done for short periods and not on a permanent or regular basis.

voca.means_en: Sometimes, for a change of pace, we rearrange the furniture in the apartment.\n

To constrain someone or something means to limit their development or force them to behave in a particular way.\nIf you feel constrained to do something, you feel that you must do it, even though you would prefer not to.\n
She was so angry that she could hardly constrain herself.\n

limit / restriction / control / constraint / restraint / limitation
A constraint is something that limits or controls what you can do.
Constraint is control over the way you behave which prevents you from doing what you want to do.

Directions are instructions that tell you what to do, how to do something, or how to get somewhere.
The direction of a film, play, or television programme is the work that the director does while it is being made.
B : Hello, my name is James Park. Could you give me directions to your hotel?

to progress very slowly and take too long

That movie just dragged on. I didn't like it so I left and went home.

voca.means_en:
Fashion is the area of activity that involves styles of clothing and appearance.
A fashion is a style of clothing or a way of behaving that is popular at a particular time.
If you do something in a particular fashion or after a particular fashion, you do it in that way.
If you fashion an object or a work of art, you make it.
If you say that something was done after a fashion, you mean that it was done, but not very well.
If something is in fashion, it is popular and approved of at a particular time. If it is out of fashion, it is not popular or approved of.

voca.means_en: Something or someone that is fashionable is popular or approved of at a particular time.\nOverall, I’m not a fashionable person. However, I do like to look presentable at all times.\n

voca.means_en:
understand / see / get / follow / grasp / comprehend
If you follow someone who is going somewhere, you move along behind them because you want to go to the same place.
If you follow someone who is going somewhere, you move along behind them without their knowledge, in order to catch them or find out where they are going.
If you follow someone to a place where they have recently gone and where they are now, you go to join them there.
I followed news of the event on TV.
A lot of my friends follow baseball.

I like to follow my own style.
It's better to follow your own style.
She dresses well, and she follows her own style.

voca.means_en:
If a liquid or a substance containing a liquid freezes, or if something freezes it, it becomes solid because of low temperatures.
If you freeze something such as food, you preserve it by storing it at a temperature below freezing point. You can also talk about how well food freezes.
When it freezes outside, the temperature falls below freezing point.
If you freeze, you feel extremely cold.
If someone who is moving freezes, they suddenly stop and become completely still and quiet.
If the government or a company freeze things such as prices or wages, they state officially that they will not allow them to increase for a fixed period of time.
If a government freezes a plan or process, they state officially that they will not allow it to continue for a period of time.
If someone in authority freezes something such as a bank account, fund, or property, they obtain a legal order which states that it cannot be used or sold for a particular period of time.

to leave a place or start a journey
(with something) to escape or nearly escape punishment
(with something) to escape or nearly escape injury in an accident
Well, you may not know this, but because it's the last day of 2014, everybody gets off work early today so that they can go back home early. 
"You got off the hook again? I can't believe it."
help somebody to avoid punishment, etc\n"You got off the hook again? I can't believe it."\n

floor / ground / land / earth / soil
The ground is the surface of the earth.
If you say that something takes place on the ground, you mean it takes place on the surface of the earth and not in the air.
You can refer to land as ground, especially when it has very few buildings or when it is considered to be special in some way.
You can use ground to refer to a place or situation in which particular methods or ideas can develop and be successful.
If an argument, belief, or opinion is grounded in something, that thing is used to justify it.
"Are you grounded for a year? Off to jail? Can I have your room?"
Volunteers pull a girl through a tiny gap, high up in the wreckage of a partially-destroyed building as Aleppo bombardment continues.\n

voca.means_en:
A hook is a bent piece of metal or plastic that is used for catching or holding things, or for hanging things up.
A hook is a short sharp blow with your fist that you make with your elbow bent, usually in a boxing match.
If you hook one thing to another, you attach it there using a hook. If something hooks somewhere, it can be hooked there.
If you hook your arm, leg, or foot round an object, you place it like a hook round the object in order to move it or hold it.
If you hook a fish, you catch it with a hook on the end of a line.
If you are hooked into something, or hook into something, you get involved with it.
If you hook into the Internet, you make a connection with the Internet on a particular occasion so that you can use it.
If someone gets off the hook or is let off the hook, they manage to get out of the awkward or unpleasant situation that they are in.
Somehow you hooked right into my magic.
Can you hook me up with the lady?
"You got off the hook again? I can't believe it."
Something that is incomplete is not yet finished, or does not have all the parts or details that it needs.\nB : I am calling you regarding the report you sent me. It seems incomplete.\n

voca.means_en: A jack is a device for lifting a heavy object off the ground, for example a car.\nA jack is a playing card whose value is between a ten and a queen. A jack is usually represented by a picture of a young man.\n

voca.means_en: to lift something such as a vehicle off the ground using a special device (a jack)\n

A jail is a place where criminals are kept in order to punish them, or where people waiting to be tried are kept.
If someone is jailed, they are put into jail.
"Are you grounded for a year? Off to jail? Can I have your room?"
Journalism is the job of collecting news and writing about it for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio.\n
If you are jumpy, you are nervous or worried about something.\n"Let me see. I wasn't the one frozen in terror. Or jumpy as a frog."\n

Justice is fairness in the way that people are treated.
The justice of a cause, claim, or argument is its quality of being reasonable, fair, or right.
Justice is the legal system that a country uses in order to deal with people who break the law.
A justice is a judge.
If a criminal is brought to justice, he or she is punished for a crime by being arrested and tried in a court of law.
To do justice to a person or thing means to reproduce them accurately and show how good they are.
If you do justice to someone or something, you deal with them properly and completely.
If you do yourself justice, you do something as well as you are capable of doing it.
If you describe someone's treatment or punishment as rough justice, you mean that it is not given according to the law.

If you describe a decision, action, or idea as justified, you think it is reasonable and acceptable.\nIf you think that someone is justified in doing something, you think that their reasons for doing it are good and valid.\n

A kettle is a covered container that you use for boiling water. It has a handle, and a spout for the water to come out of.
A kettle is a metal pot for boiling or cooking things in.
If you say that something is a different kettle of fish, you mean that it is very different from another related thing that you are talking about.

voca.means_en: Someone who is knowledgeable has or shows a clear understanding of many different facts about the world or about a particular subject.\n

voca.means_en:
look / glance / gaze / stare / glimpse / glare
If you look in a particular direction, you direct your eyes in that direction, especially so that you can see what is there or see what something is like.
If you look at a book, newspaper, or magazine, you read it fairly quickly or read part of it.
If someone, especially an expert, looks at something, they examine it, and then deal with it or say how it should be dealt with.
If you look at someone in a particular way, you look at them with your expression showing what you are feeling or thinking.
If you look for something, for example something that you have lost, you try to find it.
If you are looking for something such as the solution to a problem or a new method, you want it and are trying to obtain it or think of it.
If you look at a subject, problem, or situation, you think about it or study it, so that you know all about it and can perhaps consider what should be done in relation to it.

I buy whatever lookes good on me.
I think this would look good on you.
That jacket doesn't look good on her.

I always like to look presentable.
You should look presentable at the meeting.
He looks presentable even early in the morning.
If you talk about the magnitude of something, you are talking about its great size, scale, or importance.\nNew Zealand's 7.8 magnitude quake ripped this mountain apart by 10 metres.\n
Donna: I'll be more than happy to do that for you. From what time?\n

partly / partially
If something happens or exists partially, it happens or exists to some extent, but not completely.

voca.means_en:
You say please when you are politely asking or inviting someone to do something.
You say please when you are accepting something politely.
You can say please to indicate that you want someone to stop doing something or stop speaking. You would say this if, for example, what they are doing or saying makes you angry or upset.
You can say please in order to attract someone's attention politely. Children in particular say 'please' to attract the attention of a teacher or other adult.
If you please is sometimes used as a very polite and formal way of attracting someone's attention or of asking them to do something.
You say 'please yourself' to indicate in a rather rude way that you do not mind or care whether the person you are talking to does a particular thing or not.
If someone or something pleases you, they make you feel happy and satisfied.
You use please in expressions such as as she pleases, whatever you please, and anything he pleases to indicate that someone can do or have whatever they want.

voca.means_en:
A pool is the same as a swimming pool. / A pool is a fairly small area of still water.
A pool of liquid or light is a small area of it on the ground or on a surface.
A pool of people, money, or things is a quantity or number of them that is available for an organization or group to use.
Pool is a game played on a large table covered with a cloth. Players use a long stick called a cue to hit a white ball across the table so that it knocks coloured balls with numbers on them into six holes around the edge of the table.
If you do the pools, you take part in a gambling competition in which people try to win money by guessing correctly the results of football matches.
If a group of people or organizations pool their money, knowledge, or equipment, they share it or put it together so that it can be used for a particular purpose.
Let's pool ideas.
Let's pool some money.
If you say that someone looks presentable, you mean that they look fairly tidy or attractive.\nIf you describe something as presentable, you mean that it is acceptable or quite good.\n

A quake is the same as an earthquake.
If you quake, you shake, usually because you are very afraid.
If you are quaking in your boots or quaking in your shoes, you feel very nervous or afraid, and may be feeling slightly weak as a result.
New Zealand's 7.8 magnitude quake ripped this mountain apart by 10 metres.

When you react to something that has happened to you, you behave in a particular way because of it.
If you react against someone's way of behaving, you deliberately behave in a different way because you do not like the way they behave.
If you react to a substance such as a drug, or to something you have touched, you are affected unpleasantly or made ill by it.
When one chemical substance reacts with another, or when two chemical substances react, they combine chemically to form another substance.
You can use regarding to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.\nB : I am calling you regarding the report you sent me. It seems incomplete.\n

rip - ripped - ripped
When something rips or when you rip it, you tear it forcefully with your hands or with a tool such as a knife.
If you rip something away, you remove it quickly and forcefully.
If something rips into someone or something or rips through them, it enters that person or thing so quickly and forcefully that it often goes completely through them.
A rip is a long cut or split in something made of cloth or paper.
New Zealand's 7.8 magnitude quake ripped this mountain apart by 10 metres.

If someone has a seizure, they have a sudden violent attack of an illness, especially one that affects their heart or brain.
If there is a seizure of power or a seizure of an area of land, a group of people suddenly take control of the place, using force.
When an organization such as the police or customs service makes a seizure of illegal goods, they find them and take them away.
If a financial institution or a government makes a seizure of someone's assets, they take their money or property from them because they have not paid money that they owe.
Marijuana can literally stop a seizure in its tracks
If you splurge on something, you spend a lot of money, usually on things that you do not need.\n

voca.means_en:
If you spoil something, you prevent it from being successful or satisfactory.
If you spoil children, you give them everything they want or ask for. This is considered to have a bad effect on a child's character.
If you spoil yourself or spoil another person, you give yourself or them something nice as a treat or do something special for them.
If food spoils or if it is spoilt, it is no longer fit to be eaten.
If someone spoils their vote, they write something illegal on their voting paper, usually as a protest about the election, and their vote is not accepted.
The spoils of something are things that people get as a result of winning a battle or of doing something successfully.
If you say that someone is spoilt for choice or spoiled for choice, you mean that they have a great many things of the same type to choose from.
to stop somewhere for a short time when you are on a long journey, especially a journey by plane\nWhy don't you stop over and we'll share a cup of coffee?\n

Terror is very great fear.
Terror is violence or the threat of violence, especially when it is used for political reasons.
A terror is something that makes you very frightened.
If someone describes a child as a terror, they think that he or she is naughty and difficult to control.
Jack laughed, too. He laughed out of sheer terror.

voca.means_en:
platform / track
A track is a narrow road or path.
A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving athletes, cars, bicycles, horses, or dogs called greyhounds.
A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving athletes, cars, bicycles, horses
Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along.
In a school, a track is a group of children of the same age and ability who are taught together.
If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example the marks left by their feet.
To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar.
To track students means to divide them into groups according to their ability.
Marijuana can literally stop a seizure in its tracks.
Lisa: Hey, Jason! Don't you get stuck in a heavy traffic jam every morning?\n
uncertain; not yet decided\nDan: I'm not sure. My plans are up in the air.\n

If something usually happens, it is the thing that most often happens in a particular situation.
You use more than usually to show that something shows even more of a particular quality than it normally does.
Usually, someone brings up sports. We could discuss politics. When we do that, sometimes we get into arguments.
Jeff: The boss usually doesn't get to the point but he did today.

A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it.
A volunteer is someone who offers to do a particular task or job without being forced to do it.
A volunteer is someone who chooses to join the armed forces, especially during a war, as opposed to someone who is forced to join by law.
If you volunteer to do something, you offer to do it without being forced to do it.
If you volunteer information, you tell someone something without being asked.
Volunteers pull a girl through a tiny gap, high up in the wreckage of a partially-destroyed building as Aleppo bombardment continues.
I like to follow my own style when it comes to fashion.\n

When something such as a plane, car, or building has been destroyed, you can refer to what remains as wreckage or the wreckage.\nVolunteers pull a girl through a tiny gap, high up in the wreckage of a partially-destroyed building as Aleppo bombardment continues.\n
These days, fashion trends are often determined by the media.\n

A type of something is a group of those things that have particular features in common.

If you say that someone is not your type, you mean that they are not the sort of person who you usually find attractive.

If you say that something is typical of a person, situation, or thing, you are criticizing them or complaining about them and saying that they are just as bad or disappointing as you expected them to be.
He is a typical Japanese.

voca.means_en:
imagine / envisage / visualize / picture / envision
If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it.
If you imagine that something is the case, you think that it is the case.
If you imagine something, you think that you have seen, heard, or experienced that thing, although actually you have not.
"I imagine." said the Brain, "that they used a satellite downfeed to get these pictures back to the studio."

voca.means_en:
limit / restriction / control / constraint / restraint / limitation
A limit is the greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible.
A limit of a particular kind is the largest or smallest amount of something such as time or money that is allowed because of a rule, law, or decision.
The limit of an area is its boundary or edge.
The limits of a situation are the facts involved in it which make only some actions or results possible.
If you limit something, you prevent it from becoming greater than a particular amount or degree.
If you limit yourself to something, or if someone or something limits you, the number of things that you have or do is reduced.
If something is limited to a particular place or group of people, it exists only in that place, or is had or done only by that group.
If an area or a place is off limits, you are not allowed to go there.
If someone is over the limit, they have drunk more alcohol than they are legally allowed to when driving a vehicle.
If you say the sky is the limit, you mean that there is nothing to prevent someone or something from being very successful.
The Brain scratched his head. "Generally speaking." he said, "minors have limited access to legal recourse or arbitration."\n

voca.means_en:
limit / restriction / control / constraint / restraint / limitation
The limitation of something is the act or process of controlling or reducing it.
A limitation on something is a rule or decision which prevents that thing from growing or extending beyond certain limits.
If you talk about the limitations of someone or something, you mean that they can only do some things and not others, or cannot do something very well.
A limitation is a fact or situation that allows only some actions and makes others impossible.

If someone reminds you of a fact or event that you already know about, they say something which makes you think about it.
You use remind in expressions such as Let me remind you that and May I remind you that to introduce a piece of information that you want to emphasize. It may be something that the hearer already knows about or a new piece of information. Sometimes these expressions can sound unfriendly.
If someone reminds you to do a particular thing, they say something which makes you remember to do it.
If you say that someone or something reminds you of another person or thing, you mean that they are similar to the other person or thing and that they make you think about them.
"Not all our books." Francine reminded him. "Just the Scare-Your-Pants-Off Club books."

"The parents group, called PAWS-Parents Against Weird Stories-says the scary stories are bad for kids. We tried unsuccessfully to reach E. A. D'Poe, the author of the books, for comment. Hoping to build more support, PAWS is holding a rally for concerned parents. They will meet on the library steps at one o' clock tomorrow afternoon."\n

A satellite is an object which has been sent into space in order to collect information or to be part of a communications system. Satellites move continually round the earth or around another planet.
A satellite is a natural object in space that moves round a planet or star.
You can refer to a country, area, or organization as a satellite when it is controlled by or depends on a larger and more powerful one.
Satellite television is broadcast using a satellite.
Suburban means relating to a suburb.\n

if you walk away from an accident, etc., you are not seriously injured
